result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Lisowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: to commence today, concurrent with any other sentence presently serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Lisowski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.  
Count 1 - Felony bail jumping - Guilty plea.   Convicted.    State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 3.   Motion granted.   
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for thirty (30) days, to commence today.   
Minutes.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.

3:05 PM Defendant Daniel J. Lisowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Daniel J. Lisowski.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement received.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Defense asks that this be set for plea/sentencing.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:29 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Carl Knepel in court for Daniel Lisowski, appearing specially for Attorney Luke Harrison. Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for State of Wisconsin.  An adjournment is being requested so that Atty. Harrison can appear with his client.  Defendant waives the time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court finds good cause to waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:33 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel J. Lisowski appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Luke Harrison appearing with the defendant.  Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping, possess Fentanyl and possess methamphetamine.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-08-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a PO hold.
Minutes.
